questions.text: After the accident in San Andreo, where were Vinick and Santos in the national poll?
questions.explanation:
Tied.

	Everyone on Santos' team was rallied around the computer looking for the poll results and when the computer froze Annabeth gave everyone the good news that she had the polling data.

True.

	Donna and Bram woke up everyone in the hotel room to tell them about the poll. Donna woke Josh up and he kissed her after finding out her news about the poll.

questions.text: Will had what article of clothing that belonged to Kate?
questions.explanation:
Bra.

	As Will and Kate were walking through the hallway, Will told Kate he had her bra in a padded envelope in his office. Kate wanted to know why he couldn't just mail the bra back to her instead of bringing it into the White House.

questions.text: Bram brought Josh the news that a musician wanted to meet Santos. What musician did Bram mention?
questions.explanation:
Bono.

	While they were campaigning, Bram brought Josh news that Bono wanted to meet Santos while he was in California. Ronna wanted to lock Bono up in a Secret Service van.

questions.text: After talking to them on the phone, who did Josh say he liked less and less?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	While at a campaign stop, Josh received a call from CJ requesting that Santos be at the White House that evening. Josh was going to have Santos in California that evening to campaign in Vinick's home state so he told CJ that he was beginning to like her less and less.

questions.text: Who came down with a cold while on the campaign trail?
questions.explanation:
Vinick.

	Vinick had a cold and a 101 degree fever. Josh wanted to know who he could thank for Vinick's wonderful cold and said he was going to send him some Vicks vapor rub and a German nurse.

questions.text: As of the time of the show, how many weeks were left before the election?
questions.explanation:
3 weeks.

	The number of days left before the election was posted on the screen when the show began and the President mentioned it during his talk with Santos and Vinick in the Oval Office.

questions.text: To shake up Vinick's campaign, Sheila fired Bruno.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Bruno thought he was going to be fired after the disaster at San Andreo, but at the end of the episode Sheila told Vinick that she had already written a letter of resignation and put it on his desk. Sheila told Vinick that she would still talk to him on the phone, but he would be working with Jane Braun.

questions.text: How many troops did the President send into Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation:
150,000.

	The President invited Vinick and Santos to the White House to tell them what was going to happen concerning China and Russia. The President told Vinick and Santos that he was sending 150,000 troops sent into Kazakhstan and he wasn't sure when they were coming out.

questions.text: Did Josh spend the night with Donna?
questions.explanation:
No.

	While at the Mariott in Washington, Donna slipped Josh the key to her hotel room, but he didn't get to use it because Edie took it to Donna thinking she had left it accidentally.
